abstract.p: Gordon Campbell leads Liberal party to landslide victory in British Colombia, ending decade of rule by Canada's most left-leaning government (S)

block.p: Gordon Campbell led the British Columbia Liberal Party to a landslide victory in provincial elections, ending a decade-long rule by Canada's most left-leaning government. The departing New Democratic Party, accused of incompetence and corruption, went from 39 seats to just 3 in the 79-seat provincial Parliament while the Liberals took 76. Mr. Campbell, the former mayor of Vancouver, has promised to cut taxes and hold a referendum on several Indian treaties that were signed over the last few years.
